intro: Tephrosia concinna, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Tephrosia concinna is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
